newsitem.title: USA: Industrial Bancorp Inc Q4 net lower.
newsitem.headline: Industrial Bancorp Inc Q4 net lower.

text.p: Industrial Bancorp Inc said Wednesday its consolidated net income for the fourth quarter of 1996 amounted to $1.4 million compared to $1.3 million earned during the fourth quarter of 1995. Net income for the year ended December 31, 1996 amounted to $2.4 million compared to $4.2 million earned during 1995.

Earnings were lower in 1996 as a result of two events which affected income. First, the FDIC levied a special assessment against institutions with SAIF-insured deposits which caused Industrial Savings and Loan to record a pre-tax expense of $1.5 million. It is anticipated that, as a result of the special assessment, FDIC deposit insurance premiums for savings and loan associations will be reduced in the future. Second, Industrial Savings and Loan recorded $1.2 million of expense for the $3.50 return of capital related to unallocated ESOP shares. Accounting for this transaction required both an expense on the income statement and an offsetting increase to surplus. As a result, there was no change in total shareholders' equity related to this transaction.

Earnings amounted to $.27 per share for the quarter and $.47 per share for the year ended December 31, 1996 compared to $.25 per share for the quarter and $.42 per share for the five months ended December 31, 1995. The net interest margin was 4.32% for the year ended December 31, 1996 compared to 4.04% for the year ended December 31, 1995.

Total assets at December 31, 1996 were $326.6 million compared to $323.0 million reported one year earlier. The return of capital in May 1996, which amounted to $19.4 million, significantly reduced asset growth for the year.
